DataElement.preferredName: Person Failure Recovered or Resolved Prior Treatment Regimen Exclusion Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to a person's failure to recover from prior therapy that prevents a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Failure Recovered or Resolved Prior Treatment Regimen Exclusion Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person's failure to recover from prior therapy that prevents a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

Property.preferredName: Failure Recovered or Resolved Prior Treatment Regimen Exclusion Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: loss of ability to function normally.:One of the possible results of an adverse event outcome that indicates that the event has improved or recuperated.:Earlier in time or order.:A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.:Exclusion; the act of restricting entrance or barring from participation.

Concepts.definition: A lack of occurrence or performance.
One of the possible results of an adverse event outcome that indicates that the event has improved or recuperated.
A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.
Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Failure to fully recover from
ReferenceDocuments.description: Failure to fully recover from acute, reversible effects of prior chemotherapy regardless of interval since last treatment
